New Records: India smashed seven records against Bangladesh
Samson's 40-ball century is one of the fastest in T20Is
India scored 22 sixes and 25 fours, the most in boundaries in a T20 innings
Three bowlers conceded 50 or more runs
Two of the 26 dot balls turned out to be no-balls
Key Match Events: Samson hit four successive fours in the second over
Suryakumar hit his first six in the powerplay
Samson drove a Mustafizur slower ball over extra cover
Rishad Hossain's two overs went for 46 runs
Parag and Pandya scored 81 off 31 balls, hitting four sixes apiece
Mayank Yadav dismissed Parvez Hossain for a golden duck
Ravi Bishnoi took three wickets in the final over
Post-Match Reflections: Samson expressed pride in the team's performance
Pandya managed to outdo Samson's back-foot six over extra cover
Miscellaneous Highlights: India's second-highest T20I score, three short of 300
Bangladesh's biggest loss in terms of runs
Bangladesh's biggest T20I defeat for a Test-playing team
